change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "package" BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 87/2022, effective April 4, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: package means a material, substance or object that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: used to protect, contain or transport a vapour product, or
attached to a vapour product or the vapour product's container for the purpose of marketing or communicating information about the vapour product;

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 87/2022, effective April 4, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to any enactment of Canada, a retailer must not sell a restricted e-substance unless the product is packaged in a plain manner that does not contain any text or image other than as required or permitted under this section.
A retailer must not sell a restricted e-substance unless the package

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: states the concentration of non-therapeutic nicotine in the restricted e-substance,

states the total volume of restricted e-substance within the package or, if the package includes multiple cartridges or containers, the volume of restricted e-substance held or that may be held in each cartridge or container,
states "WARNING: nicotine is highly addictive", and
shows the warning symbol set out in the Schedule.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A retailer is permitted to sell a restricted e-substance in a package that states one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and contact information of the manufacturer;
the brand name and product name;

change.changenote: Section 14 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 87/2022, effective April 4, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who contravenes section 4 (1) or (2), 5 (1), 6 (1) or (2), 7 (1), 8 (1) or (2), 10 (1) or (2), 11 (1) or (2) or 12 (2) or (3) of this regulation commits an offence.

change.changenote: Section 16 BEFORE self repealed by BC Reg 186/2020, effective September 15, 2021.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: effective date means the date on which this section comes into force;
existing stock means vapour products that, on the effective date, a previous seller

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has contracted for but has not yet taken possession of;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: previous seller means a retailer who was lawfully selling vapour products immediately before the effective date.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite sections 6 to 8 [restrictions and packaging standards], a previous seller may, until September 15, 2020, sell existing stock in contravention of those provisions.

Despite sections 5, 10 and 11 [notice required before sale and reports] but subject to subsection (4), a previous seller may sell restricted e-substances on or after the effective date if the previous seller gives, before September 15, 2020,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a notice of intent in accordance with section 5 (2) (a) and (b), and
reports in accordance with sections 10 (1) (a) to (g) and 11 (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A previous seller who gives a notice of intent and reports as described in subsection (3) after August 3, 2020 but before September 15, 2020 may not sell restricted e-substances after September 15, 2020 until at least 6 weeks have passed since the date on which the previous seller gave the notice of intent and reports.
